definitions.definition: A part , usually performed by instruments, that gives support or adds to the background in music, or adds for ornamentation ; also, the harmony of a figured bass .
examples: Brooks performed a saxophone solo on stage, with Robert as accompaniment on the bass.

definitions.definition: That which accompanies ; something that attends as a circumstance , or which is added to give greater completeness to the principal thing, or by way of ornament , or for the sake of symmetry .
examples: A side salad is a common accompaniment to a main dish.

main_definition: ( music ) A part , usually performed by instruments, that gives support or adds to the background in music, or adds for ornamentation ; also, the harmony of a figured bass .
secondary_definitions: That which accompanies ; something that attends as a circumstance , or which is added to give greater completeness to the principal thing, or by way of ornament , or for the sake of symmetry .
